segment.source: What is Microsoft Passport?

segment.source: Windows Hello provides a robust way for a device to recognize an individual user; that addresses the first part of the path between a user and a requested service or data item.

segment.source: Microsoft Passport isn’t just a replacement for traditional 2FA systems, though.

segment.target: It’s conceptually similar to smart cards: authentication is performed by using cryptographic primitives instead of string comparisons, and the user’s key material is secure inside tamper-resistant hardware.

segment.target: In particular, you don’t need a PKI if you don’t currently have one.

segment.source: Microsoft Passport combines the major advantage of smart cards — deployment flexibility for virtual smart cards and robust security for physical smart cards — without any of their drawbacks.
